title: SS.PT.404
prompt: Drag and drop the following events to put them in correct chronological order.
description: In August 1945 the United States unleashed a new weapon of mass destruction against the Japanese at Hiroshima and Nagasaki and brought an end to World War II... In 1945 the United States possessed a monopoly on this new dreadful weapon. The exclusiveness was short-lived, however. In 1949 the Soviet Union exploded its first atomic bomb. Although the United States and the Soviet Union had been wartime allies, by this time they had become peacetime enemies with conflicting ideologies and competing global interests. In an attempt to get or maintain an advantage in the power and numbers of nuclear weapons, both nations embarked on an arms race...
feedback: You can use the dates given in the passage to establish the chronology of two key events: the U.S. bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki (event #2) and the Soviet Union exploding its first bomb (event #3). The phrase "had been wartime allies" (event #1) signals that this event occured before the others. The passage states that once the war had ended, the United States and the Soviet Union became "peacetime enemies." (event # 4) The arms race (event #5) occured because the United States and the Soviet Union had become "peacetime enemies."
